speaker: PAUL HANGEMUHL
line: Marie!

speaker: MARIE HANGEMUHL
line: No! Please!

speaker: FLASHBACK SCULLY
line: Mulder was dying... it's all right here. For a year he was going to doctors.

speaker: FLASHBACK SCULLY
line: There's a clear record of his decline.

speaker: FLASHBACK DOGGETT
line: How well did you really know him? How far would Mulder go?

speaker: FLASHBACK SCULLY
line: How far would he go for what?

speaker: FLASHBACK DOGGETT
line: The truth... his truth.

speaker: FLASHBACK DOGGETT
line: Whatever you and I may differ on...

speaker: FLASHBACK DOGGETT
line: I'll find him, Agent Scully.

speaker: SHERIFF KURT FREY
line: You must be Special Agent Doggett. I'm Sheriff Frey. Just call me Kurt.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I appreciate the help, Kurt.

speaker: SHERIFF KURT FREY
line: Shame to have you drive all the way up here on a Saturday. Hate to say you're wasting your time.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Not if you confirm what you told me before.

speaker: SHERIFF KURT FREY
line: Yes, sir. Agent Mulder was here, all right... last spring.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: You said on the phone Agent Mulder was investigating a missing woman, Marie Hangemuhl.

speaker: SHERIFF KURT FREY
line: Well, she wasn't exactly missing. He wasn't exactly investigating, either.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I'm not following you.

speaker: SHERIFF KURT FREY
line: It was a false report. Marie never even left the house. The only reason Agent Mulder found out about it was because Marie's sister got all excited about nothing. There. See for yourself.

speaker: SHERIFF KURT FREY
line: Say, I've got some hot coffee and a danish here if you're interested.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: No, thanks.

speaker: SHERIFF KURT FREY
line: You know, if you don't mind me asking, Agent Doggett, what's your interest? I mean, I was actually surprised that one FBI agent gave this case a thought.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: It's not so much the case as it is the agent. Agent Mulder disappeared last May.

speaker: SHERIFF KURT FREY
line: Sorry to hear that. I still don't see what that has to do with us.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Did Agent Mulder have a personal connection here-- something that might not be in your report?

speaker: SHERIFF KURT FREY
line: No, I don't think he'd ever been to Squamash before, as far as I know.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I have cell phone records showing that Agent Mulder came back here the week before he disappeared.

speaker: SHERIFF KURT FREY
line: What for?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: That's what I want to know. It's my job to find him.

speaker: PAUL HANGEMUHL
line: Kurt?

speaker: SHERIFF KURT FREY
line: Paul, this is Agent Doggett from the FBI. He'd like to ask you and Marie some questions.

speaker: PAUL HANGEMUHL
line: Marie, can you come out here a minute?

speaker: PAUL HANGEMUHL
line: This is an FBI agent. He wants to ask us a few questions. What's this all about?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: A colleague of mine, Fox Mulder, questioned you last spring.

speaker: PAUL HANGEMUHL
line: Come on, Kurt. This again? Look, this was a personal matter that's been blown way out of proportion.

speaker: SHERIFF KURT FREY
line: He's not investigating you, Paul. He's investigating Agent Mulder.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: If you could tell me what you and Agent Mulder talked aboutâ€¦ MULDER is talking to PAUL HANGEMUHL and MARIE HANGEMUHL. MULDER presses his fingers against the bridge of his nose as he asks the question. He looks as if he is in pain.)

speaker: MULDER
line: You told your sister you were going to disappear, Mrs. Hangemuhl. Tonight.

speaker: PAUL HANGEMUHL
line: I told you already. We had a fight, she was going to leave, not disappear.

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm talking to your wife.

speaker: MULDER
line: Mrs. Hangemuhl.

speaker: MARIE HANGEMUHL
line: It's what he said. My sister lives out of state. I was going to go... I didn't want her to worry.

speaker: MULDER
line: You told your sister a story, a story you were afraid of?

speaker: PAUL HANGEMUHL
line: This is crazy. There is no crime here!

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't think you were going anywhere tonight, Mrs. Hangemuhl. I think someone or something was coming here. And I think maybe it still is.

speaker: PAUL HANGEMUHL
line: We had a fight. We patched things up and that was the end of it.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: The Sheriff's report says that Agent Mulder spoke to you on Saturday, May 6th.

speaker: MARIE HANGEMUHL
line: Yeah, I-I guess so.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Did you see Agent Mulder again that night?

speaker: PAUL HANGEMUHL
line: No, he never came back.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: According to his cell phone records, he did. To this area, anyway.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: What's that there? Is that a dialysis machine?

speaker: PAUL HANGEMUHL
line: My wife suffers from end-stage renal failure. She's a very sick woman.

speaker: PAUL HANGEMUHL
line: Anything else?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: One thing. This someone or something Agent Mulder said might be coming?

speaker: MARIE HANGEMUHL
line: I just told my sister I was afraid of the stories. That's all, I didn't mean...

speaker: PAUL HANGEMUHL
line: Let me ask you something, Agent Doggett. Was this Mulder guy sick? Sick in the head, I mean? Is that why you're checking into this?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: What stories, Mr. Hangemuhl?

speaker: PAUL HANGEMUHL
line: An Indian folk legend about a creature who lives out in the woods.

speaker: PAUL HANGEMUHL
line: I've heard these stories since I was a kid. So your colleague twisted it into a theory that she was going to disappear, all right 'cause this creature was coming to eat her.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Eat her?

speaker: PAUL HANGEMUHL
line: Alive.

speaker: SHERIFF KURT FREY
line: Like I said, Agent Doggett, I hate to waste your Saturday.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: The Hangemuhls own a gun, Kurt?

speaker: SHERIFF KURT FREY
line: No, I don't think so. Why?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I saw three holes plastered over in their living room wall.

speaker: SHERIFF KURT FREY
line: Gunshots?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Possibly.

speaker: SHERIFF KURT FREY
line: You want to go back and ask 'em?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: No.

speaker: PAUL HANGEMUHL
line: Kurt, they told me you were out here. I just can't believe it. Is it true?

speaker: SHERIFF KURT FREY
line: That's what I'm here to find out.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Were you aware Mulder carried a second weapon, a Walther PPK?

speaker: SKINNER
line: Yeah, in an ankle holster.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I found it hidden under his sink. The clip was three rounds shy.

speaker: SKINNER
line: What's this about?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Three shots were fired in a house where Mulder investigated a case last May. He never filed a report on the case or the discharge of his weapon. Do you know any reason why?

speaker: SKINNER
line: If Mulder did these things, he would've reported them.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Mulder submitted case reports, all right but they indicate he was here in Washington on days his cell phone records prove he was in Pennsylvania.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Are you calling Mulder a liar?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: This is the muzzle of Mulder's pistol. You see that there?

speaker: SKINNER
line: It's blowback.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Macrospatter of dried blood in a semi-circular pattern. Which indicates Mulder fired close-range at something or someone.

speaker: SKINNER
line: I've heard enough.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Where are you going?

speaker: SKINNER
line: It's where you're going, Agent Doggett. You're trying to build a case that what? Mulder killed a man and then made himself disappear? That's not what happened. I told you before, he was abducted. I saw it!

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Agent Mulder signed falsified case reports.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Oh, come on, John, this isn't about Mulder, it's about you! Your career. You give the FBI a narrative for Mulder's disappearance, you're off the X-Files and back on the fast-track to the directorship.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I'm just trying to find the truth.

speaker: SKINNER
line: You want the truth? Then ask Agent Scully!

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I can't do that.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Why not?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Because she... she signed those case reports, too.

speaker: SKINNER
line: You take that story to OPR, the accusation alone could cost Scully her job.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I'm not taking it to OPR. I'm taking it to you.

speaker: DOG OWNER
line: Hold back.

speaker: SHERIFF KURT FREY
line: We're giving you two minutes to bring it outside! Then we're coming in to get it!

speaker: SHERIFF KURT FREY
line: Where is it?

speaker: BLONDE RUSTIC WOMAN
line: It's dead. You know that. Dead and buried.

speaker: SHERIFF KURT FREY
line: It's here. We've come for it.

speaker: PAUL HANGEMUHL
line: You lied to us!

speaker: BLONDE RUSTIC WOMAN
line: Please, don't! Don't do this! Don't do this to him!

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Sheriff Frey.

speaker: SHERIFF KURT FREY
line: Back again?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: This is Assistant Director Skinner. We drove up when we couldn't reach you on the phone.

speaker: SHERIFF KURT FREY
line: Yeah, sorry about that. I went hunting and turned off my radio. So. You find something?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: You might say that.

speaker: SKINNER
line: You filed this death certificate at the county seat, Sheriff. We're hoping you might be able to tell us something about it.

speaker: SHERIFF KURT FREY
line: Yeah. Yeah, last spring. An unidentified transient. Local woman found the body in the woods.

speaker: SKINNER
line: You got no suspects? No motive?

speaker: SHERIFF KURT FREY
line: No, why?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: You get a lot of shootings around here? That why you failed to mention this one, Kurt?

speaker: SHERIFF KURT FREY
line: What are you insinuating?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: The body was found dumped outside this woman's cabin on Sunday, May 7-- the morning after Mulder saw the Hangemuhls.

speaker: SHERIFF KURT FREY
line: Okay, so I didn't make the connection. So what?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Three rounds were missing from Mulder's weapon.

speaker: SHERIFF KURT FREY
line: So Mulder came back to town to kill this man and now the Hangemuhls are lying about it. Maybe I am, too.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Pretty much.

speaker: SHERIFF KURT FREY
line: This theory is even nuttier than the one Agent Mulder came to town with. Where's the evidence?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Where's the body buried?

speaker: SKINNER
line: You're on pretty shaky ground here, Agent Doggett.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Something happened here that night.

speaker: SKINNER
line: But you're forgetting one thing-- Fox Mulder wouldn't do this.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Look, somebody shot this man. Somebody fired Mulder's weapon and Mulder was here that night.

speaker: SKINNER
line: And you trying to prove that Mulder's a murderer is going to help you find him?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Maybe he's not. I'm not saying that he did this. Not yet. But he was here for a reason and then he disappeared.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Why would these people, people he'd never met before try to cover it up?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: That's the question, yeah.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Earth is fresh.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Sheriff must've dug it up this afternoon after I left.

speaker: SKINNER
line: What would he want with the body?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I don't know that he found it.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Looks like there's another way out.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Are you telling me the man inside that casket did this?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Looks pretty deep. A man doesn't get shot three times and then tunnel out of his own grave.

speaker: SKINNER
line: The Sheriff said this transient was unidentified, right?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: That's right.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Then why'd somebody leave these on top of his grave?

speaker: SHERIFF KURT FREY
line: We've got to move fast.

speaker: PAUL HANGEMUHL
line: She's not ready yet.

speaker: SHERIFF KURT FREY
line: Then she better get ready.

speaker: MARIE HANGEMUHL
line: I can't do this.

speaker: PAUL HANGEMUHL
line: You've got to do this. We don't have another choice.

speaker: SHERIFF KURT FREY
line: Paul?

speaker: SHERIFF KURT FREY
line: Marie.

speaker: PAUL HANGEMUHL
line: I'll be waiting for you.

speaker: MARIE HANGEMUHL
line: No!

speaker: PAUL HANGEMUHL
line: Our father, who art in heaven... hallowed be thy name...

speaker: PAUL HANGEMUHL
line: What is it now?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Mind if we come in?

speaker: PAUL HANGEMUHL
line: What do you think you're doing?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Looking for the Sheriff. He was here, wasn't he?

speaker: PAUL HANGEMUHL
line: Look, I've had a long day and I want to go to bed, so if you don't mind...

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Agent Mulder came back here that night and shot a man in this room. You know why, and so does your wife.

speaker: PAUL HANGEMUHL
line: I want you guys out of my house, now. Hey, did you hear me?!

speaker: SKINNER
line: Mr. Hangemuhl, we'd like to speak with your wife. Where is she?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Where is she, Mr. Hangemuhl?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Something happened here and I'm going to figure out what it is.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Agent Doggett.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Looks like you missed a spot, Mr. Hangemuhl.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Agent Doggett.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Hangemuhl says his wife must've coughed up the blood. He insists he didn't harm her.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Of course he says that.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Maybe he didn't.

speaker: SKINNER
line: What are you talking about?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: You said it before, Mulder wouldn't do this-- shoot a man in cold blood. Unless he was trying to protect Mrs. Hangemuhl.

speaker: SKINNER
line: From who?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: From the man that's supposed to be buried in that coffin.

speaker: SKINNER
line: The county police found something you ought to look at.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Mr. Hangemuhl must've just used water to clean this.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Thank you. Otherwise... we might not have found it.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Look familiar?

speaker: BYERS
line: We learned what we could. This is somewhat short notice, of course.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: And a little outside our area of expertise.

speaker: LANGLY
line: Plus the fact we were sleeping.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: You wearing pants, Langly?

speaker: LANGLY
line: Uh...yeah.

speaker: SKINNER
line: We don't have much time. What did you find?

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Thought you'd never ask, big guy.

speaker: BYERS
line: The pattern you described to us is most likely a medicine wheel. It's a symbol for healing usually associated with North American shaman.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Now, the circle represents the continuum between life and death. The journey is separated by two roads, one for happiness, one for sorrow.

speaker: BYERS
line: Lakota Indians teach that all these elements-- life, death, sorrow, happiness-- are all one. But it takes an enlightened mind to see it.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Why paint it on a door, or mark it on a grave?

speaker: LANGLY
line: Well-- that's the part that takes some conjecture there, Agent Dogbird.

speaker: BYERS
line: We don't know what Mulder was doing out there.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: But legends date back hundreds of years of a sin-catcher shaman also known as a soul eater.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: A soul eater?

speaker: LANGLY
line: They minister to the sick-- legend has it they consume their illnesses.

speaker: BYERS
line: The symbol might be placed on a grave as a sign of respect. Or on a door as a summons.

speaker: SKINNER
line: A summons for what?

speaker: BYERS
line: To indicate a sick person lives there, someone in need of the creature's healing gift.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Thanks for your help, boys.

speaker: LANGLY
line: Yeah, you're welcome.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Marie Hangemuhl suffered from a kidney disease.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Agent Doggett?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: That wasn't a transient buried in that grave.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Sorry to disturb you at this hour, ma'am. I'm Agent Doggett with the FBI. May I come in?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: The Sheriff's report last May said you found a body in the woods out here.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Look, the people of this town are keeping a secret about that body-- about who it is. There was an FBI agent who came here because he believed that it was some kind of a "soul eater."

speaker: BLONDE RUSTIC WOMAN
line: Maybe it is.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: You believe it, too. You put those stones on top of his grave.

speaker: BLONDE RUSTIC WOMAN
line: The things you're asking about-- they've been this way for hundreds of years. You can't change them.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: A colleague of mine came here to try and kill this thing last spring. I believe he was trying to protect a woman named Marie Hangemuhl. I need your help.

speaker: BLONDE RUSTIC WOMAN
line: You've got it all backward.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I'm going to get you out of here.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Agent Doggett. How is she?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: She feels fine, you believe that? The doctor says Mrs. Hangemuhl's kidneys have spontaneously healed. She's a healthy woman.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Explain that.

speaker: SKINNER
line: You're going to have to explain it. The Sheriff's waiting to take your statement.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: The Sheriff knows. He's known all along. So's her husband.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Known what?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: That this soul eater took her to cure her. I thought Mulder shot this man to protect Marie Hangemuhl. But it wasn't her he was trying to protect.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Where are you going?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Something happened here. It just wasn't what we thought.

speaker: BLONDE RUSTIC WOMAN
line: To understand what this thing is you have to understand what it can do-- its gift. People hate it because they need it. It looks the way it does because of their sickness.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: You care for this man.

speaker: BLONDE RUSTIC WOMAN
line: Someone always has.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Because you believe it? That it can cure people's sickness?

speaker: BLONDE RUSTIC WOMAN
line: Not cure. Consume.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Mulder came to see you last year. Not to save Marie Hangemuhl. To save himself.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Mulder was dying, but he kept it a secret. He had an undiagnosed brain disease. He was a sick man, desperate to find a cure.

speaker: BLONDE RUSTIC WOMAN
line: They all are.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Mulder didn't do it.

speaker: BLONDE RUSTIC WOMAN
line: Agent Mulder saw how it suffered. He saw it in its eyes. I knew what needed to be done. I just couldn't bring myself to do it.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Mulder killed it.

speaker: BLONDE RUSTIC WOMAN
line: He couldn't bear to add to its pain.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: So he came back here that night to take its pain away.

speaker: BLONDE RUSTIC WOMAN
line: They buried it. It wanted to die. It still does, but it can't. All these months I've kept it here in secret. But now that they know it's back it'll keep suffering.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Sheriff, as a federal officer I'm asking you and your men to get out of my way.

speaker: SHERIFF KURT FREY
line: You can't take it, Agent Doggett. It belongs to us.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: This is a man. He doesn't belong to anybody.

speaker: SHERIFF KURT FREY
line: We have sick people. Sick people who need what it has. We're taking it. You're free to go.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: No, sir. I'm driving this man out of here.

speaker: MAN
line: Sheriff.

speaker: SHERIFF KURT FREY
line: It'll come back. It always does.

speaker: BLONDE RUSTIC WOMAN
line: All these years we didn't know what it could do. It took your death. You freed it.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: A.D. Skinner, you're here late.

speaker: SKINNER
line: So are you.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I wanted to finish my case report before Agent Scully comes in tomorrow morning.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Have you?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I don't even know where to begin or how to explain it. Only thing I do know is is I'm no closer to finding Mulder now than when I started this thing.

speaker: SKINNER
line: You got inside of his head, Agent Doggett. You understood why Mulder did something I wouldn't have thought him capable of doing. You want some free advice? Don't write that report. You turn that in you open up a world of trouble for Agent Scully. And yourself.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: She didn't know anything about this, sir. Of that I'm certain.

speaker: [CARRIK
line: Good boy! Already learning to protect Scully.]

speaker: SKINNER
line: How many months will be lost proving that? How much damage done to her good name? And Mulder's? And to yours? For what?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: The truth.

speaker: SKINNER
line: You and I both know what happened out there, Agent Doggett. No one else needs to.
